messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Baseball was Re: on playing for life
messages.msgSnippet: ... When Sosa came up to bat before that homerun, I thought Wouldn t that be nice? Oh yeah! My dh said after that homerun that Sosa would be breaking out of
messages.messageBody:
> I think so too, last nite, 11 innings! Cubs didn't even it up again, but did
> you see that Sosa home run in the 9th??? HOLY SH*T, the people downstairs
> prolly got mad at me I was screaming and jumping up and down!

When Sosa came up to bat before that homerun, I thought "Wouldn't that be
nice?" Oh yeah! My dh said after that homerun that Sosa would be breaking
out of his slump. After tonight's game, you almost have to believe it :)

> I was relieved to see he's still on the show this year, everybody good keeps
> leaving....and HE BETTER do the Sox fan thing, pronto!!

Oh yeah! I have a feeling there will be lots of Schwartzenegger skits, too.

Amy
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99) and Cole (9/03/02)
"Allow children to be happy in their own way, for what better
way will they find?"
--Dr, Samuel Johnson
http://thissideofsomewhere.blogspot.com/

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Baseball was Re: on playing for life

messages.messageBody:
acnelson@... writes:
> The playoffs are really exciting this year -
> at least I think!
>


I think so too, last nite, 11 innings! Cubs didn't even it up again, but did
you see that Sosa home run in the 9th??? HOLY SH*T, the people downstairs
prolly got mad at me I was screaming and jumping up and down!

<<Jimmy Fallon does some skits with his Boston
character on SNL now that the Sox are this far >>

I was relieved to see he's still on the show this year, everybody good keeps
leaving....and HE BETTER do the Sox fan thing, pronto!!

~Aimee

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Baseball was Re: on playing for life
messages.msgSnippet: ... So were we :) ... I usually don t make a point to watch sports on tv, but I enjoy watching them if Cory is watching them. The playoffs are really exciting
messages.messageBody:
> SOX WIN, SOX WIN...I was watching the last few innings last nite!

So were we :)

> Now, I'm a fair weather fan, lol. I like all sports but usually find it
> boring to watch on TV, not the same as being there. So I only watch my teams
> and
> the playoffs.

I usually don't make a point to watch sports on tv, but I enjoy watching
them if Cory is watching them. The playoffs are really exciting this year -
at least I think!

> A match up between the Sox and Cubs, can that happen, for the World Series? (
> yah, I am so well informed about baseball!)

LOL! Yep, it could :)

> I hope it doesn't, too many
> people to disappoint either way...But, Yankees can bite me, so.....( even tho
> I
> lived for quite a few years in NY). GO SOX!! Until they play the Cubs, of
> course!

I actually hope they do play each other. Talk about two teams that have been
waiting a looong time! I hope Jimmy Fallon does some skits with his Boston
character on SNL now that the Sox are this far. Cubbies all the way! My dh
plans to get a tattoo (his first) if they win it all.

Amy
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99) and Cole (9/03/02)
"Allow children to be happy in their own way, for what better
way will they find?"
--Dr, Samuel Johnson
http://thissideofsomewhere.blogspot.com/

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Baseball was Re: on playing for  life
messages.msgSnippet: YES!!!   That was the most back and forth, moment to moment, unbelievably tense game I ve ever seen!   And this from a woman who frowns at dh s frequent need
messages.messageBody:
YES!!! That was the most back and forth, moment to moment, unbelievably
tense game I've ever seen! And this from a woman who frowns at dh's
frequent need to watch sports. But it is the Red Sox and I grew up in
Boston and as much as they so frequently in the past have stomped on our
hearts by taking us to the brink and then just missing it.... I am tempted
to take my newly baseball-loving 6yo to Boston to watch a game at Fenway
(and just to be in Fenway is such an experience, so many great stories he
could hear from his grandfather about all the past Fenway moments...) w/
his uncle who has an extra ticket... but the 3yo would have to go along for
the veeeeery long ride so I have to just be happy we have TV . Go SOX!!!!!!!!

Madeline

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Baseball was Re: on playing for life
messages.msgSnippet: ... SOX WIN,  SOX WIN...I was watching the last few innings last nite! Now, I m a fair weather fan, lol.  I like all sports but usually find it boring to watch
messages.messageBody:
acnelson@... writes:
> My dh isn't quite old enough to have been waiting 95 years for this (LOL!),
> but he's been waiting for about 20. He muffled his shouts of joy in a pillow
> last night because Cole was asleep :) And he's a native Minnesotan.


SOX WIN, SOX WIN...I was watching the last few innings last nite!

Now, I'm a fair weather fan, lol. I like all sports but usually find it
boring to watch on TV, not the same as being there. So I only watch my teams and
the playoffs.

A match up between the Sox and Cubs, can that happen, for the World Series? (
yah, I am so well informed about baseball!) I hope it doesn't, too many
people to disappoint either way...But, Yankees can bite me, so.....( even tho I
lived for quite a few years in NY). GO SOX!! Until they play the Cubs, of
course!

~Aimee


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
My dh isn't quite old enough to have been waiting 95 years for this (LOL!),
but he's been waiting for about 20. He muffled his shouts of joy in a pillow
last night because Cole was asleep :) And he's a native Minnesotan.

Amy
